noun.description: A frothy white mass of bubbles produced by soap or a similar cleansing substance when mixed with water.
A state of agitation or nervous excitement.
examples: Larry was worked into a lather and shouted at the mayor

verb.description: (with reference to soap or a similar cleansing substance) form or cause to form a frothy white mass of bubbles.
examples: soap will not lather in hard water

verb.description: Cover something with liberal amounts of (a substance)
examples: she lathered a slice of toast with butter

verb.description: (of a horse) be covered with sweat.
examples: the old mare was lathered and I decided it was time for a rest

origin: Old English læthor (denoting washing soda or its froth), lēthran (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Old Norse lauthr (noun), from an Indo-European root shared by Greek loutron bath.
